content.data: Preferences
image758.gif
image183.gif
There are 4 tabs in the Preferences screen:
General Tab
image183.gif

CNC 
	 Programs -  This area allows you to select the Maximum Run Number 
	 and Run Number Range to utilize for Program Names. 
 
 Run Number 
		 Formats 
 
 3 
			 Digit Numeric  - With this number type the first 3 characters 
			 in the program name are nnn. This allows up to 1000 outputs 
			 without repeat. (000-999) 
 Alpha-Numeric  
			 - With this number type the first 3 characters in the program 
			 name are Rnn/Raa. This allows up to 1296 outputs without repeat. 
			 (R00-RZZ) 
 Standard  
			 - With this number type the first 3 characters in the program 
			 name are Rnn. This allows up to 100 outputs without a repeat. 
			 (R00-R99) 
 
 Run Number Range 
 
 This option will 
			 accommodate those shops that have multiple users outputting 
			 NC programs and want to assign allowing each user a range. 
			 Jeff = 0-99, Sally=100-199, John=200-299 etc. In addition 
			 the user can get a preview of the run number output by specifying 
			 the various number formats.

Show 
	 Parts Not Set for Optimization or Output -  This option allows 
	 you to turn on the capability to control whether a Part set to "Not 
	 Optimize" can be overridden. Doing this will turn on Right Click 
	 menu options in the Part List. See the  Parts  
	 topic for more information. 
 One Click Optimize To Pattern Results -  
	 Enable this option to go straight from clicking the  Optimize  
	 button to the Pattern area.

Show 
	 Parts Not Set for Optimization or Output -  This option allows 
	 you to turn on the capability to control whether a Part set to "Not 
	 Optimize" can be overridden. Doing this will turn on Right Click 
	 menu options in the Part List. See the  Parts  
	 topic for more information.

Show 
	 Parts Not Set for Optimization or Output -  This option allows 
	 you to turn on the capability to control whether a Part set to "Not 
	 Optimize" can be overridden. Doing this will turn on Right Click 
	 menu options in the Part List. See the  Parts  
	 topic for more information.

One Click Optimize To Pattern Results -  
	 Enable this option to go straight from clicking the  Optimize  
	 button to the Pattern area.

One Click Optimize To Pattern Results -  
	 Enable this option to go straight from clicking the  Optimize  
	 button to the Pattern area.
Geometry
image184.gif
There is one option on the Geometry Tab:

Max Pre-Mill 
	 Edgebanding  - The S2M Center will compensate for Edgebanders 
	 with Pre-Mill Stations; by selecting this option you are indicating 
	 to the S2M Center that your Edgebander has a Pre-Mill Station. If 
	  Max  is selected 
	 then the value is the maximum amount the banding machine will trim 
	 off the edge of the part during the banding operation.  Typically 
	 the banding machine trims off a value equal to the banding thickness. 
	 If  Fixed  is selected 
	 this is the amount the banding machine will trim off of the edge of 
	 the part that include banding.

Max Pre-Mill 
	 Edgebanding  - The S2M Center will compensate for Edgebanders 
	 with Pre-Mill Stations; by selecting this option you are indicating 
	 to the S2M Center that your Edgebander has a Pre-Mill Station. If 
	  Max  is selected 
	 then the value is the maximum amount the banding machine will trim 
	 off the edge of the part during the banding operation.  Typically 
	 the banding machine trims off a value equal to the banding thickness. 
	 If  Fixed  is selected 
	 this is the amount the banding machine will trim off of the edge of 
	 the part that include banding.

Max Pre-Mill 
	 Edgebanding  - The S2M Center will compensate for Edgebanders 
	 with Pre-Mill Stations; by selecting this option you are indicating 
	 to the S2M Center that your Edgebander has a Pre-Mill Station. If 
	  Max  is selected 
	 then the value is the maximum amount the banding machine will trim 
	 off the edge of the part during the banding operation.  Typically 
	 the banding machine trims off a value equal to the banding thickness. 
	 If  Fixed  is selected 
	 this is the amount the banding machine will trim off of the edge of 
	 the part that include banding.

Modifying the Max pre-mill edge banding will dynamically change the part 
 size of banded parts.
Information.png
Reports
image188.gif

Saw 
	 Report  - This option allows you to determine which Saw 
	 Pattern Report to use by default. 
 Saw 
	 Optimization  - These options allow you to select whether you 
	 want Offcuts and Gap Cuts (when Grain Matching) to be reported.

Saw 
	 Report  - This option allows you to determine which Saw 
	 Pattern Report to use by default.

Saw 
	 Optimization  - These options allow you to select whether you 
	 want Offcuts and Gap Cuts (when Grain Matching) to be reported.

Saw 
	 Optimization  - These options allow you to select whether you 
	 want Offcuts and Gap Cuts (when Grain Matching) to be reported.

Measurement 
 Units

The  Measurement Units  tab allows 
 access to the area where your standard display unit of measure and its 
 precision are set. Keep in mind that the S2M Center stores everything 
 as a double integer in the Imperial (Inches) unit of measure. What you 
 are selecting is how the S2M Center  displays  
 this stored information  not  
 how it is stored.
image191.gif

A double Integer consists of 15 unit places, meaning a measurement entered 
 as 56mm is actually stored as 2.20472440944881” by the S2M Optimizer. 
 The measurement entered by you at 56mm would display as follows:

Units 
 as Millimeters
Precision as 1 = 56
Precision as 1.5 = 56.0
Precision as 1.1 = 56.0
Precision as 1.01 = 56.00
Precision as 1.001 = 56.000

Units 
 as Inches
Precision as 1 = 2
Precision as 1.1 = 2.2
Precision as 1.01 = 2.20
Precision as 1.001 = 2.205
Precision as 1/8 = 2 1/4
Precision as 1/16 = 2 3/16
Precision as 1/32 = 2 7/32
Precision as 1/64 = 2 13/64

The important thing 
 to remember is the S2M Optimizer sees this number (56mm), no matter how 
 you have the display units set, as 2.20472440944881”.
Information.png

The "Trim trailing decimal zeros" will simply trim any trailing 
 zeroes off of displayed decimal measurements.

The "Allow unit-switch button on Status Bar" options turns 
 on/off the Unit-switch button in the  Statusbar 
 Menu .
Tools Tab (Accessible from  Part Edit  area)
image193.gif

Smart-lines.  In 
 this section you can control the Snap Angle as well as the Tolerance setting 
 of a drawn Line.

A  Snap 
 Angle  of 45 and a high Tolerance (Sliding the bar all the way to 
 the right) will snap lines only in 45 degree increments.

A  Snap 
 Angle  of 45 and a low Tolerance (Sliding the bar all the way to 
 the left) will basically disable the Snap feature. This will basically 
 allow you to draw a free-hand line.

Snap Lines.  In 
 this section you can control the Color and Type (Dashed or Solid) of line 
 that Dynamic Snapping will use.

Snapping Options.  
 In this section you can control the Snap Hot-Keys as well as which Hot-Points 
 are on for Dynamic Snapping.

Grid 
 Snap -  Snaps what you are currently placing to Grid points.

Point 
 Snap -  Snaps what you are currently placing to Snap points.

Short-cut 
 Keys.  In this section you can modify the default Short-cut Keys 
 for quick commands inside Solid. You may want to change these if they 
 interfere with Short-cut Keys you may already have setup in Windows. There 
 are five functions that can be controlled by short-cut keys:

Pan 
 -  The Pan function allows you to set a new View center. When activated 
 the Pan feature will center your current view to the location of the cursor 
 on the screen.

Refresh 
 -  The Refresh function instructs Solid to redraw the current View.

Zoom Mode.  In this 
 section you control how the Windows for a Zoom Window is drawn.

From 
 Corner -  When using this and performing a Zoom Window you specify 
 the corners of your Zoom area diagonally.

From 
 Center -  When using this and performing a Zoom Window you start 
 from the Center of the View. This is the way Solid has normally performed 
 a Zoom Window.

Factor 
 -  This slider sets the Zoom Factor for Scroll Wheel Zooming. The 
 lower (left) the setting the smaller the Factor.

Reverse 
 Scroll Wheel Zoom Direction   -  
 An option allowing you to reverse the Zoom In/Zoom Out direction on your 
 Mouse Scroll Wheel.
